definition: to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: In math, the students were 5.8 points ahead. Most tests are scored on a scale of roughly 475 to 800.
sentences.chinese: 多數學生考分都在475至800分之間。

sentences.english: He managed to get into college in spite of his bad grades.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他的考分很低，他還是想方設法進了大學。

sentences.english: A class of 50 students have participated the examination, and the results are believed to be true and convinced.
sentences.chinese: 一班50名學生在不測的情況下應試，考分真實可信。

definition: horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)

college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
the sciences (as opposed to the humanities 文科[wen2 ke1])
entrance exam for senior middle school
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to enter oneself for an examination
